    • Field Detail

      • userList

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,core.ApplicationUser> userList
        The userList contains key-value pairs of bank account IDs to their cached application users. We use this when creating and deleting users to/from the system.

      • barcodeList

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> barcodeList
        The barcodeList contains key-value pairs of bank account IDs to an array of available barcode tokens for the given user. When barcodes have been used during the transaction process, the value is set to null in the array.

      • BARCODE_LIMIT

        public static final int BARCODE_LIMIT
        A configurable setting for the amount of barcodes a given user can have. Our initial limit is 10, meaning that after 10 transactions without a call to the POST /barcode resource will deplete the user of barcodes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserManager

        public UserManager()

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public static core.ApplicationUser addUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                                           java.lang.String lastName,
                                           java.lang.String cprNumber,
                                           java.lang.String token)
        Adds an user to the system storage, which we can then check up on later.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the user.
        lastName - The last name of the user.
        cprNumber - The CPR number of the user. Make sure this is unique. ^___^
        token - The bank account ID of the user in the FastMoney bank.
        Returns:

      • generateAndReturnBarcodes

        public static java.lang.String[] generateAndReturnBarcodes(java.lang.String token)
        Finds all the used barcode tokens for the user and refills those spots. In case there are not yet stored any barcode tokens for the user, we generate enough barcodes to fill the capacity In case all barcodes are not yet used, no changes are made
        Parameters:
        token - The bank account ID of the user to refill the barcode tokens for
        Returns:
        the list of barcode tokens for the user

      • getAccountIdFromBarcode

        public static java.lang.String getAccountIdFromBarcode(java.lang.String barcodeToken)
        Checks if there exists an account which has the given barcode token stored
        Parameters:
        barcodeToken - The barcode token to look for
        Returns:
        The bank account ID of the user which has this barcode token

      • removeBarcode

        public static void removeBarcode(java.lang.String userId,
                                 java.lang.String barcodeToken)
        Removes a barcode token from our storage. Used when a transaction process has completed. We're using the bank account ID as well, because it makes for small performance gain compared to the getAccountIdFromBarcode.
        Parameters:
        userId - The bank account ID of the user with the barcode token
        barcodeToken - The barcode token
